Bianca's Blog

A page serving as my journal entries.


Welcome to a space where I get to share my journal entries in a blog post format to keep my visitors up-to-date on exciting news, things I've learned and random thoughts. Follow me along in this exciting journey through Correlation One!

Website Anatomy
May 1, 2023

I decided to brand my website with my name, which I opted to add at the top left of the page along with the LinkedIn logo which is clickable and will take you to my actual LinkedIn page. I incorporated a top navigation bar with the Home page being the landing page itself and the About Me page which I repurposed from an earlier assignment and this gives a significantly more detailed story about myself. I've added a Blog page which will be used as a journal. The last part of the navigation bar is a placeholder for what is supposed to be a Searchbar.

I decided to draw attention to the main, future, purpose of the website by using colors that direct the user to fill out the form with a brief description of how they would like my help in designing their own website. Below that I opted to add a brief introduction about myself, the purpose of the webiste and screenshots of the work I've done in class so far. At the very bottom of the page, I wanted to recreate your standard footer with information about the "brand" (hense myself), resources I used, a fake Legal section, and a Lets Chat! section where visitors can email me directly, learn about me and view my LinkedIn page.
My Exciting Future Through Software Development
May 2, 2023

When I started my Software Development course with Correlation One, I actually knew absolutely nothing about web development. To tell you, I had never seen a line of code nor understood how a website was even composed. I was and am still very nervous about my ability to keep up with everyone else as many of my peers seem to have a ton of experience. I'm committed to seeing this through and making a career out of my learnings from this program.

So far, we have been building up our HTML skills and have recently started practicing CSS. The fact that I am even able to piece this website together makes me excited about my future as some things are, surprisingly, sticking with me. I am wanting to be creative with my approaches to my projects and take quite some time in figuring out how to even start. I hope that in the near future, my web development and design skills become second nature and a strong skill set to leverage my career.
